item.title: Toyota Corolla Levin 1600 (1972)
item.description:
Publication: Car Graphic
Format: Road Test
Date: June 1972
Author: “C/G Test Group” (uncredited)

Summary: A fun car with the 1.6-liter DOHC engine from the Celica/Carina GT mounted in a Corolla body. It is powerful, flexible, and has an excellent gearbox, but is slightly low-geared overall. The ride and roominess are adequate despite the reinforced suspension, and the maneuverability is excellent thanks to the 175-width tires, but fuel economy is poor and the noise level is high.
